publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Edward Blount, and are to be sold at his shop in Pauls Churchyard, at the signe of the Black Beare,

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Brydges by STC (2nd ed.) and NUC pre-1956 imprints. "Also attrib. to Gilbert Cavendish, to William Cavendish, and to Thomas Hobbes"--STC (2nd ed.).
Includes special t.p.'s for the following sections: A discourse upon the beginning of Tacitus -- A discourse of Rome -- A discourse against flatterie -- A discourse of lauues.
Reproductions of originals in the Cambridge University Library (reel 829) and Bodleian Library (1725).

place.placeName: his shop in Pauls Churchyard, at the signe of the Black Beare
